Top 5 online Texas real estate schools

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ text_font=”Open Sans||||||||” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”18px” text_line_height=”1.8em” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”0px||-15px||false|false” text_font_size_tablet=”18px” text_font_size_phone=”15px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Choosing one of the best online Texas real estate school is crucial for your career, and it’s important to thoroughly research your options and understand what each course offers. While there are countless real estate schools available, only a select few stand out for their exceptional education and comprehensive support in preparing you to obtain your real estate license.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we are committed to guiding new agents in launching successful careers. That’s why we’ve curated a list of the leading online real estate schools in Texas. Our detailed analysis covers the offerings of each school, their course delivery methods, and a balanced view of the advantages and disadvantages of studying with each one.

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A+
Top Feature: Ability to study on the go with the mobile app

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”16px” header_3_font_size=”20px” custom_margin=”||16px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Why We Chose It:

AceableAgent has quickly become a favorite among students due to its modern approach and flexibility. It is exclusively focused on real estate education, offering courses for every step of a real estate career, from pre-licensing to continuing education and career advancement. The courses are state-approved and designed to be accessible from any device, providing students with the flexibility to study anywhere.

Overview:

AceableAgent offers three pre-licensing packages, all of which include the required coursework. The courses are fully online and accessible via desktop, laptop, tablet, or smartphone. This accessibility is one of AceableAgent’s standout features, allowing students to study on the go. Courses are developed by experienced professionals and are accredited by ARELLO. Additionally, AceableAgent is known for its interactive coursework, which helps students grasp and retain information effectively.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_video src=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sPEVlc9Zp_M” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”600px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”40px||40px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_video][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”16px” header_3_font_size=”20px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Why AceableAgent is Great for Pre-Licensing:

AceableAgent’s pre-licensing courses are available in multiple states, ensuring they meet state-specific requirements. The courses include engaging video lectures, interactive content, and practice exams to help students prepare effectively for their licensing exams. AceableAgent offers a satisfaction guarantee and provides career resources to help new agents start their careers successfully.

User Experiences and Feedback:

Students have reported that AceableAgent’s courses are particularly user-friendly, with a modern interface that makes navigation easy. The mobile app is highly rated for its convenience, allowing users to study during commutes or breaks. The interactive content, including quizzes and video explanations, has been praised for making complex topics easier to understand. Additionally, AceableAgent’s customer service, though sometimes slow, is generally helpful and responsive to student needs.

Pre-Licensing

Exam Prep

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $89
Basic Package Features: There are a bunch of separate ones but the main 18-hour package includes TREC-Approved 18-Hour Course Package: Five courses, all in one place, covering 2024-2025 requirements. Start immediately with no classroom needed. Engaging, up-to-date content available anytime.

Flexible Learning Options: Enjoy self-paced courses that fit your schedule.

Extended Course Access: Access course materials for up to six months from your enrollment date.

Risk-Free Enrollment: Benefit from a 30-day money-back guarantee if you’re not satisfied.

Exam Success Guarantee: Pass the licensing exam within three tries or receive a full course refund.

Comprehensive Exam Preparation: Gain access to a variety of study tools including prep videos, 75 audio lessons, digital flashcards, over 1600 practice questions, a 100-page exam prep ebook, weekly live webinars, live Q&A sessions with instructors, and the option for personalized 1-on-1 tutoring.

Dedicated Support: Instructor assistance is available seven days a week via email, and customer service can be reached by email and phone from Monday to Friday.

Convenient Final Exams: Utilize online proctoring services for the final exam across the nation, although California students do not need a proctor for their pre-licensing exam.

Mobile-Friendly Platform: Study anytime, anywhere with a course platform that is fully optimized for mobile devices.

Interactive Learning Tools: Engage with interactive content designed to enhance your learning experience and retention.

Career Resources: Access additional career support services to help you transition from student to professional agent successfully.

Why We Chose It: The CE Shop offers a variety of real estate education options with an interactive and inquiry-based approach in their studying methods. While their focus is mainly on continuing education, they also provide excellent pre-licensing courses, exam prep, and post-licensing education. Their courses are accredited by ARELLO and have received numerous awards for their educational programs.

Overview: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses can be taken in 34 states, through four different course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Every package comes with business ebooks, career resources, downloadable resources, real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students have praised the course content for being easy to follow and highly informative, which has led to high pass rates.

This approach helps students apply their knowledge to practical situations they will face in their real estate careers. Additionally, The CE Shop provides an exam prep edge program that offers additional practice tests and study aids to ensure students are well-prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: The CE Shop is well-regarded for its robust customer support and comprehensive resources. The ability to access instructor-led webinars provides an additional layer of support and interaction, which can be particularly beneficial for students who need more guidance. The frequent promotions and discounts make it a cost-effective option for many. Students appreciate the clear and structured study schedules, which help them stay on track and complete the course efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $111.20

Basic Package Features: Expert-written business eBooks, career resources, downloadable materials, digital flashcards, a real estate glossary, a study schedule, and 135 hours of CA pre-licensing preparation.

Upgrade Packages: The Premium Package includes everything in the Basic Package, plus exam prep ($135 value), a pass guarantee, Kickstarter professional development ($99 value), the Real Estate Basics and Beyond eTextbook ($35 value), and a 45-hour first renewal package ($79 value).

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $101.25

Basic Package Features: Offers content based on the California DRE Instructions to License Applicants, ensuring comprehensive coverage of every exam topic. It features individual lessons for efficient studying, real-time dashboards to gauge exam readiness, and 7-day support via call, chat, or email.

Upgrade Packages: None

Post-Licensing

Price Starts at: $79

Basic Package Features: This 45-hour CE package includes 17 mandatory hours (ethics, agency, fair housing, trust fund handling, risk management, implicit bias), 19 consumer protection hours (real estate finance, commercial real estate, environmental awareness, sexual harassment and discrimination, assistance animals and fair housing), and 9 consumer service hours (marketing, business planning, investor strategies).

Upgrade Packages: Yes, this package includes the ProPath Real Estate Business Builder program, covering essential pricing strategies, tax planning for the self-employed, and budgeting to build your business for real estate success.

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $79

Basic Package Features: Same as Post-Licensing package.

Upgrade Packages: Same as Post-Licensing package.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $412
Basic Package Features: Texas Salesperson License Package: 180-hour instruction to qualify for the Texas Salesperson license, covering essential real estate principles and business knowledge. Includes six 30-hour courses: Principles of Real Estate I & II, Law of Agency, Law of Contracts, Promulgated Contracts and Forms, and Real Estate Finance.
Upgrade Packages: ProPath Real Estate Career Kickstarter: Includes the “Real Estate Basics and Beyond” eTextbook and three actionable courses: 30/60/90 Day Plan, Core Lead Network, and Negotiation Skills. Total of 9 hours of professional development to kickstart your real estate career, though it doesn’t count towards CE credits.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $101.25
Basic Package Features: Exam Prep Based on Your Candidate Handbook: Tailored program covers every exam topic using the Texas Candidate Handbook. Individual lessons for focused study, gauges to track exam readiness, and 7-day support via call, chat, or email.
Upgrade Packages: None

Post-Licensing

Price Starts at: $409
Basic Package Features: Texas SAE Post-Licensing Package: A 90-hour program fulfilling mandatory requirements for the first renewal cycle, excluding Texas Legal Update 1 & 2. Includes three 30-hour courses: Real Estate Appraisal, Real Estate Investment, and Real Estate Brokerage.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, The ProPath Real Estate Business Builder offers three key courses: Pricing Strategies for mastering home pricing, Tax Planning for managing finances and choosing retirement plans, and Budgeting to estimate earnings and plan for taxes. It’s designed to set you up for success in real estate.

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $145
Basic Package Features: This 18-hour package meets Texas license renewal requirements with 11 mandatory and 7 elective hours. It includes courses on Texas Legal Updates I & II (4 hours each), Document Diligence (3 mandatory, 1 elective hour), Ethical Dilemmas (3 elective hours), and Investor Strategies (3 elective hours).
Upgrade Packages: Yes, This package includes the ProPath Real Estate Business Builder program, covering Pricing Strategies, Tax Planning, and Budgeting to ensure long-term success in your real estate career.

_module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”left” title_font_size=”31px” custom_margin=”||12px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”16px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Our Review Process:

At SmartAgentAlliance, our goal is to provide accurate and helpful reviews of online real estate schools to assist prospective real estate agents in making informed decisions. Our review process involves several key steps:

Research and Data Collection:

We begin by gathering comprehensive information about each real estate school, including course offerings, pricing, accreditation, and user reviews. This involves visiting the schools’ websites, reading third-party reviews, and gathering feedback from current and former students.

Evaluation Criteria:

Our evaluation is based on several important criteria, including:

    • Course Quality:

      We assess the content and structure of the courses to ensure they cover all necessary topics comprehensively and are easy to follow.

    • Accessibility:

      We evaluate the flexibility and accessibility of the courses, including the availability of mobile apps and study materials.

    • Pass Rates:

      We consider the pass rates of students who have completed the courses and taken the licensing exam.

    • Student Support:

      We look at the level of support provided to students, including access to instructors, customer service, and additional resources like study guides and practice exams.

    • Pricing:

      We compare the cost of the courses relative to the value they offer, including any discounts or payment plans available.

    • User Feedback:

      We gather and analyze feedback from students who have taken the courses to get an understanding of their experiences and satisfaction levels.

Scoring and Ranking:

Each school is scored based on the evaluation criteria, and an overall score is calculated. The scores are then used to rank the schools, with additional considerations given to standout features that may set a school apart from the rest.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”left” title_font_size=”31px” custom_margin=”||11px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_accordion open_toggle_text_color=”#000000″ toggle_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”#383838″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” toggle_text_color=”#000000″ toggle_level=”h3″ toggle_font=”|600|||||||” toggle_font_size=”23px” custom_margin=”16px||0px|||” rank_math_faq_schema=”on” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}” box_shadow_color__hover=”rgba(12,113,195,0.41)” box_shadow_color__hover_enabled=”on|hover”][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What are the top online Texas real estate schools?” open=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

AceableAgent, The CE Shop, Allied Real Estate Schools by Colibri, RealEstateU, and 360 Training.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What is included in the pre-license courses for Texas?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Florida pre-license courses include 63 hours of state-required education covering real estate law, principles, and practices, with a final exam requiring a minimum score of 70% to pass. The courses are self-paced and fully online.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How do I choose the best online Texas real estate school?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

To choose the best online real estate school in Texas, consider factors like course content, flexibility, student support, and pass rates.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Are online real estate courses self-paced?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Yes, most online real estate courses are self-paced, allowing you to study at your own convenience. This flexibility is ideal for students who need to balance their studies with work or other commitments.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Do online real estate schools offer exam prep?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Support varies by school but generally includes access to instructors via email or chat, customer service support, and sometimes live webinars or Q&A sessions.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How much do online real estate courses cost?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The cost of online real estate courses varies by school and package. Basic pre-license courses can start around $100, while comprehensive packages with additional features like exam prep and career support can cost several hundred dollars.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Can I get a refund if I’m not satisfied with the course?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Most online real estate schools offer a refund policy, typically within a certain period (e.g., 30 days) if you haven’t completed a significant portion of the course. Check the specific refund policy of the school you choose.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Is there support available if I have questions during the course?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Yes, reputable online real estate schools offer student support through various channels such as email, phone, and live chat. Some also provide instructor-led webinars and Q&A sessions.

Before getting into the specific steps, it’s important to understand the fundamental requirements for obtaining a Texas real estate license. Here’s what you need to know:

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Age Requirement” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Applicants must be at least 18 years old to apply for a real estate license in Texas. This age requirement ensures that applicants have reached a level of maturity and legal responsibility needed for the profession.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Residency and Identification” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

You don’t need to be a Texas resident to obtain a license, but you must have a valid Social Security number. This identification is essential for the background checks and compliance with state regulations. Out-of-state applicants must fulfill the same criteria as Texas residents.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Honesty and Integrity” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Integrity is a cornerstone of the real estate profession. The Texas Real Estate Commission (TREC) will conduct a detailed background check, and any criminal convictions may lead to a denial of your application. Being transparent about any past legal issues and showing evidence of rehabilitation can positively influence your application.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step1″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/1-1.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”smiles” background_pattern_color=”rgba(12,113,195,0.05)” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”4px|auto||auto||” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 1: Take a Real Estate Pre-Licensing Course” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||40px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

In Texas, aspiring real estate agents must complete 180 hours of pre-licensing education. This education is divided into several courses that cover critical topics such as real estate principles, contracts, and Texas-specific laws.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Course Breakdown” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”||-17px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_5,1_5,1_5,1_5,1_5″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Real Estate Principles I & II (60 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

These courses provide a strong foundation in real estate, covering essential concepts such as property ownership, land use controls, and state regulations. Mastering these principles is vital for anyone aiming to succeed in the Texas real estate industry.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Law of Agency (30 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

This course focuses on the legal relationships between agents, brokers, and clients. It covers the responsibilities and duties of real estate professionals under Texas law, helping ensure that agents can effectively represent their clients.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Law of Contracts (30 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

In this course, students learn about the creation and enforcement of contracts in real estate transactions. It includes the necessary forms, clauses, and legal considerations required to draft and execute contracts legally in Texas.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Promulgated Contract Forms (30 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

This course delves into the specific contract forms required by the Texas Real Estate Commission (TREC). Understanding these forms is crucial for legally binding agreements in real estate transactions.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Real Estate Finance (30 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

This course covers the financial aspects of real estate, including mortgage lending, loan processing, and financial calculations. It’s designed to equip agents with the knowledge they need to assist clients with securing and managing financing for real estate purchases.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Choosing the Right Real Estate School” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”||-17px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”21px||-29px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Selecting the right real estate school is crucial. Look for accredited schools that offer flexibility, especially if you have a busy schedule. Online courses can provide the convenience of studying at your own pace.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Research and Reviews:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/1-2.webp” alt=”a magnifying glass and yellow stars, how to get a real estate license in california” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Start by researching various real estate schools and reading reviews from past students. Look for schools with high pass rates for the real estate exam and positive feedback on their teaching methods.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Online vs. In-Person:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/2-2.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Decide whether you prefer online or in-person classes. Online courses offer flexibility and convenience, allowing you to study at your own pace. In-person classes provide direct interaction with instructors and peers, which can enhance your learning experience.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Course Materials and Support:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/3-1.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Evaluate the course materials and support services provided by the school. High-quality textbooks, interactive lessons, and access to instructors for questions can significantly impact your success. Some schools also offer additional resources like exam prep courses and study groups.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”3px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ title=”Study Tips” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”||-17px|||” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Daily Study Schedule:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Create a daily study schedule that covers all exam topics, ensuring regular review sessions. (Asana provides a great FREE task manager)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Flashcards:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Utilize flashcards for key terms and concepts to enhance memorization. (These Quizlet Flashcards may be helpful)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Practice Tests:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Regularly take practice tests to gauge your understanding and get familiar with the exam format. (Free Texas Real Estate Practice Exam)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step2″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/2-1.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”cubes” background_pattern_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.05)” background_pattern_size=”cover” box_shadow_style=”preset6″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 2: Submit Your Texas Real Estate License Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After completing your pre-licensing education, the next step is to submit your license application to the Texas Real Estate Commission (TREC)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Steps to Submit Your Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_tabs active_tab_background_color=”#383838″ active_tab_text_color=”#FFFFFF” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” tab_font=”–et_global_body_font|500|||||||” tab_font_size=”16px” background_color=”#FFFFFF” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22active_tab_background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_tab title=”Step 1″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Complete the Application Form: Fill out the online application through the TREC website. You can create an account and access the application portal directly.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Step 2″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Gather Required Documents: Ensure you have proof of completed pre-licensing education and your identification documents ready for submission.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Step 3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Schedule Fingerprinting: Schedule an appointment with an approved fingerprinting service provider. TREC requires that your fingerprints be submitted to the Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS).

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Step 4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Submit Your Application: Submit your application online through TREC’s eLicensing system. Double-check that all information is accurate and complete before submission.

[/et_pb_tab][/et_pb_tabs][et_pb_heading title=”Application Processing Time” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”55px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

TREC typically takes several weeks to process your application. They will review your education transcripts and verify that all requirements are met. Make sure your application is complete to avoid delays.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Tracking Your Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”55px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

You can track the status of your application online through TREC’s website. Regularly checking the status can help you stay informed of any issues or additional requirements. If there are delays, contacting TREC directly can provide clarification and help expedite the process.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/3.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”smiles” background_pattern_color=”rgba(12,113,195,0.05)” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 3: Pass the Texas Real Estate Exam” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The exam is a 4-hour test with 125 multiple-choice questions. You need to score at least 58% to pass. Each attempt requires a new application and a fee of $54.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Salesperson Examination Content” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”5px||-17px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Property Fundamentals” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Course-Material.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font_size=”18px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • This category encompasses the essential characteristics and legal frameworks surrounding real estate. It includes the foundational aspects of property, its legal identification, and how it can be used or modified.
  • Included Topics:
    • Real property characteristics, legal descriptions, and property use
    • Forms of ownership, transfer, and recording of title
    • Property disclosures and environmental issues

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Real Estate Transactions and Practices” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Practice-Exams.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font_size=”18px” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • This category focuses on the processes and practices involved in conducting real estate transactions. It includes the legal agreements between parties, standard practices within the industry, and the steps required to complete a transaction.
  • Included Topics:
    • Real estate contracts and agency
    • Real estate practice
    • Financing and settlement

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Valuation and Analysis” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Study-Group.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font_size=”18px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • This category deals with the assessment of property value, including the methods used to appraise real estate and the mathematical calculations required in real estate transactions.
  • Included Topics:
    • Property value and appraisal
    • Real estate math calculations

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Preparation Tips” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”5px||-17px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Review Course Materials: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Course-Material.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Go over the textbooks and notes from your pre-license courses. Revisiting these materials can reinforce your understanding of key concepts. Focus on areas where you feel less confident to ensure a well-rounded preparation.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Practice Exams: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Practice-Exams.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Take as many practice exams as possible. This helps you get familiar with the exam format and identify areas where you need more study. Practice exams can also help you manage your time effectively during the actual test. (Free Texas Real Estate Practice Exam)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Study Groups: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Study-Group.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Join or form study groups. Discussing topics with peers can enhance understanding and retention. Study groups provide a platform to share knowledge, ask questions, and support each other.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Exam Prep Courses:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Exam-Prep-Course.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Consider enrolling in an exam prep course for additional support and structured study. These courses often include practice exams, study guides, and expert instruction. Investing in a prep course can increase your chances of passing the exam on the first attempt.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||3px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Exam Day Tips” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”10px||-10px||false|false” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_margin=”-11px|auto||auto||” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Arrive Early: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Arrive-Early.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Ensure you arrive at the exam center early to avoid any last-minute stress. Arriving early gives you time to settle in and focus before the exam begins. Check the location and travel time in advance to plan your journey.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Bring Required Identification:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Bring-Required-Identification.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

You’ll need a valid photo ID to enter the exam. Make sure your ID is current and matches the name on your application. Having all necessary documents ready can prevent any issues at the exam center.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Stay Calm and Focused:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Stay-Calm.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Read each question carefully and manage your time wisely. Staying calm and composed can help you think clearly and avoid mistakes. Take deep breaths and stay positive throughout the exam.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Exam Room Etiquette:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Etiquette.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Follow all instructions given by the exam proctors. Adhering to the rules ensures a smooth and fair testing experience for everyone. If you have any questions or issues, ask the proctors for assistance.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/4.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”cubes” background_pattern_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.05)” background_pattern_size=”cover” box_shadow_style=”preset6″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 4: Complete the Fingerprinting Requirement” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After passing the Texas real estate exam, you must complete the fingerprinting requirement for a background check. This is a crucial step to ensure you meet the honesty and integrity standards set by the Texas Real Estate Commission (TREC).

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”How to Get Fingerprinted” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_tabs active_tab_background_color=”#383838″ active_tab_text_color=”#FFFFFF” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” tab_font=”–et_global_body_font|500|||||||” tab_font_size=”16px” background_color=”#FFFFFF” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22active_tab_background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_tab title=”Live Scan Service: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Use a fingerprinting service provider approved by the Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS). The electronic fingerprinting process, known as Live Scan, is quick and secure. Locate a nearby service provider and schedule an appointment. The cost for this service typically ranges from $40 to $60.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Submit the Live Scan Form: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

At your appointment, your fingerprints will be captured and electronically submitted to both the Texas DPS and the FBI for background checks. Be sure to keep a copy of any receipts or confirmation forms for your records.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Fingerprinting Fees:” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Prepare to pay the fingerprinting fee, which varies depending on the provider. This fee covers the cost of the fingerprinting service as well as the background check. Verify the total cost when you schedule your appointment.

[/et_pb_tab][/et_pb_tabs][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

TREC will use your fingerprints to conduct a thorough background check. This process ensures you meet the necessary standards of honesty and integrity required for a Texas real estate license. Any issues identified during this check may need to be resolved before your license is approved.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Addressing Background Check Issues” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”44px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If any concerns arise from your background check, you may need to provide additional documentation or explanations. Demonstrating honesty and accountability for past actions can positively influence TREC’s decision. If you encounter complex issues, consider seeking legal advice to navigate the situation effectively.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/5.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”smiles” background_pattern_color=”rgba(12,113,195,0.05)” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 5: Submit the Salesperson License Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After passing the exam and completing the fingerprinting requirement, the next step is to submit your Sales Agent License Application to the Texas Real Estate Commission (TREC). This application confirms that you have met all the necessary requirements.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Application Checklist” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”5px||-17px|||” custom_padding=”||3px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Complete the Online Application:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Fill out the Sales Agent License Application form available through the TREC online portal. Ensure that all sections are completed accurately. You can access the form on the TREC website.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Attach Exam Results:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Include proof that you have successfully passed the Texas real estate exam. This documentation is essential for TREC to verify your eligibility. Keep a copy of your exam results for your records.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Include Fingerprinting Proof:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Attach the receipt or confirmation form from your Live Scan service provider. This document confirms that you have completed the fingerprinting requirement. Ensure all necessary signatures and details are included.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Pay the License Fee:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

As of 2024, the fee is $225. This fee must be submitted along with your application. Be sure to keep a copy of your payment receipt for future reference.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After submitting your application, you can track its status online through the DRE’s website. Regularly checking the status can help you stay informed about any updates or additional requirements. If there are delays, contacting the DRE directly can provide clarity and expedite the process.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step6″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/6.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”cubes” background_pattern_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.05)” background_pattern_size=”cover” box_shadow_style=”preset6″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 6: Find a Real Estate Broker to Sponsor You” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After passing the Texas real estate exam, your next step is to find a sponsoring broker to activate your license. It’s essential to choose a brokerage that aligns with your career goals and offers the support you need to thrive in the real estate industry.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Considerations” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_tabs active_tab_background_color=”#383838″ active_tab_text_color=”#FFFFFF” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” tab_font=”–et_global_body_font|500|||||||” tab_font_size=”16px” background_color=”#FFFFFF” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22active_tab_background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_tab title=”Brokerage Culture:” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Seek a brokerage with a culture that is supportive and collaborative. The right cultural fit can greatly influence your job satisfaction and overall success.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Commission Splits: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Be sure to understand the financial structure of potential brokerages. Different firms offer varying commission splits, so choose one that aligns with your financial expectations and career goals.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Training and Mentorship: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Early career development is critical. Choose a broker who offers comprehensive training programs and mentorship opportunities, as these are crucial for building your skills and confidence.

[/et_pb_tab][/et_pb_tabs][et_pb_heading title=”Questions to Ask Potential Brokers” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”44px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

17 Brokerage Interview Questions

  • What training programs do you offer for new agents?
  • How does your commission split work, and are there any additional fees?
  • What kind of support and resources will I have access to?
  • Can you provide references from other agents in your brokerage?

Choosing the right broker is crucial as it impacts your early career significantly. Consider top-rated brokers like eXp Realty, Keller Williams, Coldwell Banker, and Compass.

_module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Starting a career in real estate involves some initial costs and financial planning. Understanding these costs and planning accordingly will help you manage your finances effectively.

All stated fees are subject to change

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Starting Costs” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” custom_margin=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Initial Expenses: These include licensing fees, marketing expenses, office supplies, and technology tools needed to start your career. For example, initial expenses may include:
    • Pre-Licensing Course: $250-$800+
    • Exam Fee: $54 per attempt
    • Application Fee: $225
    • Fingerprinting Fee: Roughly $37
    • Marketing Materials: Business cards, signage, and online advertising costs

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” custom_margin=”||0px|||” hover_enabled=”0″ global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″]

  • When you join a brokerage in Texas, many will require you to become a member of the National, State, and Local Associations of Realtors. You’ll also need to budget for fees related to the Multiple Listing Service (MLS) and Supra Key services.
    • National Association of Realtors (NAR):
      • Membership Fees: For 2024, the NAR annual dues are $156, plus a $45 special assessment fee for the Consumer Advertising Campaign, bringing the total to $201 per year.
    • Texas Association of Realtors (TAR) (now known as Texas Realtors):
      • Membership Fees: The annual dues for Texas Realtors in 2024 are approximately $150. This is separate from the NAR dues.
    • Local Association of Realtors:
      • Membership Fees: Local association fees in Texas vary based on the specific association. For example:
        • Houston Association of Realtors (HAR): The annual dues are approximately $400 to $500.
        • Austin Board of Realtors (ABoR): The dues typically range from $250 to $350 per year.
    • Multiple Listing Service (MLS):
      • Fees: MLS fees in Texas depend on the region. For instance, HAR’s MLS fees are about $420 annually, while ABoR’s MLS fees are around $450 per year.
    • Supra Key Fees:
      • Fees: Supra Key services in Texas typically include an initial setup fee, which is around $50, and a monthly service fee ranging from $20 to $25.

These fees can vary slightly depending on your exact location and the specific associations or MLS you join. It’s always a good idea to confirm the current fees with the local associations or MLS for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Budgeting Tips” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”40px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Create a Budget: Track your expenses and forecast your income. Plan for slower months to ensure financial stability.
  • Emergency Fund: Set aside an emergency fund to cover unexpected expenses or slow periods in the market

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Income Management” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Commission Structure: Real estate agents typically earn commissions from sales. Understand how your brokerage’s commission structure works and how to manage irregular income streams. Commission splits can vary widely, typically ranging from 50/50 to 70/30 or higher, depending on the brokerage.
  • Tax Planning: As an independent contractor, it’s important to plan for taxes. Keep track of deductible expenses, make estimated tax payments, and maintain good record-keeping practices. Consulting with a tax professional can help ensure compliance and optimize your tax strategy.

box_shadow_color__hover=”rgba(12,113,195,0.41)” box_shadow_color__hover_enabled=”on|hover”][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What are the requirements to get a Texas real estate license?” open=”on” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

To qualify for a Texas real estate license, you must be at least 18 years old, a U.S. citizen or legal resident, and complete 135 hours of pre-licensing education.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How much does it cost to get a real estate license in Texas?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The cost to get a real estate license in Texas typically ranges from $566 to $1,316, including a pre-licensing course ($250-$800), exam fee ($54 per attempt), application fee ($225), and fingerprinting fee ($37). Additional expenses may include optional test prep courses ($50-$200) and a license renewal fee of $245 every four years.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How long does it take to get a real estate license in Texas?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

It typically takes between 2 to 6 months to get a real estate license in Texas. The exact timeline depends on how quickly you complete the 180 hours of required pre-licensing education, pass the exam, and submit your application. The processing time for the application with the Texas Real Estate Commission (TREC) can take an additional 2-3 weeks.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What is the pass rate for the Texas real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The pass rate for the Texas real estate exam is approximately 58% for all candidates on their first attempt. This means that just over half of the test-takers pass the exam on their first try.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What happens if I fail the Texas real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

If you fail the Texas real estate exam, you are allowed up to three attempts to pass both the national and state portions of the exam. If you fail either portion three times, you are required to complete 30 hours of additional education for each failed portion before you can retake the exam.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How do I renew my Texas real estate license?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

To renew your Texas real estate license, you must complete 18 hours of continuing education (CE), including 4 hours each of Legal Update I and II. Once your CE credits are recorded, you can renew your license online through the Texas Real Estate Commission (TREC) website. The renewal fee is $110 if done online. Be sure to renew your license before it expires to avoid additional late fees.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
